title: DeSoto just released at Veer
content:
DeSoto is a family of 4 faces based on a few letters from a 1958 DeSoto magazine ad. It's an extended width titling face with a luxurious yet warm feel. Each face is fully loaded with features including old style numbers, case-sensitive punctuation, alternates and ligatures, fractions, swashes and ornaments, and Central European language support. Joe Newton at Veer created the butterflies with ornaments and swashes.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124095846im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DeSoto-butterflies_5206.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124095846im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CTT0000238_P_5708.gif)
author: Stephen Rapp

comments.content:
This typestyle proves just how good of a lettering artist you really are Stephen. Your ability to adapt to different styles is incredible and it shows!

Good Job!

Just now saw the comments.  
Thanks John and Charles! It is a definite departure from my usual bag of tricks.

Stephen
